{"step_by_step_thinking": "Swine flu, also known as H1N1, was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization in 2009, as stated in Document [0]. A pandemic refers to a disease that is prevalent over a whole country or the world. An epidemic refers to a widespread occurrence of an infectious disease in a community at a particular time. An endemic is a disease that exists permanently in a particular region or population. Seasonal variation refers to a disease that has a pattern of occurrence in particular seasons. Given this, the correct answer is that swine flu is considered a pandemic.", "answer_choice": "A"}
